extractions.description: The paper examines the biases in Conversational Recommender Systems (CRS) by surveying recent literature. It identifies different types of biases, discusses their impacts, and proposes directions for future research.

title.value: Tidying Up the Conversational Recommender Systems’ Biases
title.justification: The title is extracted directly from the provided paper.
title.quote: Tidying Up the Conversational Recommender Systems’ Biases

type.justification: The study involves analyzing recent literature to explore biases within conversational recommender systems.
type.quote: this paper aims to systematically categorize and analyze biases unique to conversational recommender systems...by offering a preliminary exploration into the intricate biases that characterize these complex systems.

research_field.justification: The paper focuses on biases in Conversational Recommender Systems, which is a specific application of Natural Language Processing (NLP).
research_field.quote: The growing popularity of language models has sparked interest in conversational recommender systems (CRS) within both industry and research circles.

sub_research_field.justification: The paper specifically investigates biases in Conversational Recommender Systems, a sub-domain of Conversational AI.
sub_research_field.quote: This study investigates biases in classic recommender systems and their relevance to CRS. Moreover, we address specific biases in CRS, considering variations with and without natural language understanding capabilities, along with biases related to dialogue systems and language models.
